Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Constructors
  • Deprecated Enum Constants
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    jparsec.ephem.event.MainEvents.Conjunction(Target.TARGET, double, MainEvents.EVENT_TIME)
    MainEvents#getPlanetaryEvent(TARGET, double, EVENT, EVENT_TIME) will give better results, although this method is indeed used in the other to obtain a fast first estimate.
    jparsec.observer.Observatory.findObservatorybyCode(int)
    The method Observatory.searchByCodeInMarsdenList(String) should be used instead.
    jparsec.ephem.moons.E.galileanSatellitesEphemerides_E2x3(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement)
    L1 ephemerides theory is recommended instead.
    jparsec.ephem.moons.E.galileanSatellitesEphemerides_E5(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement)
    L1 ephemerides theory is recommended instead.
    jparsec.ephem.event.Saros.getAllEclipses(double, double)
    The methods in MainEvents should be used instead.
    jparsec.astrophysics.photometry.Photometry.getBlackBodyColorIndex(double, Photometry.FILTER, Photometry.FILTER, boolean)
    This method is not accurate, use Photometry.getColorIndexUsingKuruczModels(double, double, double, FILTER, FILTER, boolean) instead.
    jparsec.ephem.probes.SatelliteEphem.getCurrentOrNextRiseSetTransit(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement, SatelliteEphemElement, double)
    The SDP8_SGP8 class is recommended instead.
    jparsec.ephem.probes.SatelliteEphem.getNextIridiumFlares(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement, SatelliteOrbitalElement, double, double, boolean, int)
    The SDP8_SGP8 class is recommended instead.
    jparsec.ephem.probes.SatelliteEphem.getNextPass(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement, SatelliteOrbitalElement, double, double, boolean)
    The SDP8_SGP8 class is recommended instead.
    jparsec.vo.GeneralQuery.getQueryToSDSS(LocationElement, GeneralQuery.SDSS_PLATE, double, boolean)
    DSS queries can also be done using SkyView.
    jparsec.time.TimeScale.getTAIminusUTC(AstroDate)
    Class EarthOrientationParameters is recommended instead.
    jparsec.time.TimeScale.getTTminusUTC(AstroDate)
    Class EarthOrientationParameters is recommended instead.
    jparsec.ephem.moons.L1.L1_theory_old(double, int, int, int)
    The 1.2 version should be used instead.
    jparsec.math.Interpolation.linearInterpolation3d(double, double)
    The method GridChartElement.getSurfaceFromPoints(jparsec.math.DoubleVector[], int) should be used instead, since it allows to use an irregurarly-sampled grid of points and its implementation has much more physical sense.
    jparsec.math.Interpolation.linearInterpolation3dInLogScale(double, double)
    The method GridChartElement.getSurfaceFromPoints(jparsec.math.DoubleVector[], int) should be used instead, since it allows to use an irregurarly-sampled grid of points and its implementation has much more physical sense.
    jparsec.ephem.planets.Newcomb.newcombSunEphemeris(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement)
    This is a very old but accurate method. Better results will be obtained with Series96 or VSOP theories.
    jparsec.ephem.event.MainEvents.OppositionOrMaxElongation(Target.TARGET, double, MainEvents.EVENT_TIME)
    MainEvents#getPlanetaryEvent(TARGET, double, EVENT, EVENT_TIME) will give better results, although this method is indeed used in the other to obtain a fast first estimate.
    jparsec.ephem.event.MainEvents.PerihelionAndAphelion(Target.TARGET, double, SimpleEventElement.EVENT, MainEvents.EVENT_TIME)
    MainEvents#getPlanetaryEvent(TARGET, double, EVENT, EVENT_TIME) is recommended instead.
    jparsec.ephem.probes.SatelliteEphem.satEphemeris(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement, boolean)
    The SDP8_SGP8 class is recommended instead.
    jparsec.ephem.moons.Dourneau.saturnianSatellitesEphemerides_Dourneau(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement)
    TASS 1.7 theory is recommended instead.
    jparsec.ephem.planets.OrbitEphem.sun(double)
    Better results can be achieved by VSOP theory.
    jparsec.ephem.moons.MoonEphem.triton(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement)
    Better ephemerides for Triton can be obtained using elliptic elements from JPL.
  • Deprecated Constructors 
    Constructor and Description
    jparsec.time.AstroDate(GregorianCalendar)
    Dates cannot be represented in a GregorianCalendar with a precision better than 1 ms.
    jparsec.math.Interpolation(double[], double[], double[], boolean)
    Class GridChartElement should be used instead, since it allows to use an irregurarly-sampled grid of points and its implementation has much more physical sense.
    jparsec.time.TimeElement(GregorianCalendar, TimeElement.SCALE)
    Dates cannot be represented in a GregorianCalendar with a precision better than 1 ms.
  • Deprecated Enum Constants 
    Enum Constant and Description
    jparsec.ephem.EphemerisElement.REDUCTION_METHOD.IAU_2000
    It is not recommended since the precession is inconsistent.
